PARAM_ITEM.PARAM_DESCRIPTION: string, which is the executable file name of the PVM process to be started. The executable must already reside on the host on which it is to be started. The name may be a file in the PVM search path or an absolute path. The default PVM search path is $HOME/pvm3/bin/$PVM_ARCH/ .
integer, specifying the number of copies of the executable file to start.
string (optional), can be a host name such as ``tequila.ens-lyon.fr'' or a PVM architecture class such as ``SUN4''.
integer, the actual number of tasks started. Values less than zero indicate a system error.

PARAM_INDENT.P: tids: row of integers, array of the tids of the PVM processes started by this pvm_spawn_independent call.

On systems that support environment, spawn passes selected variables from parent environment to children tasks. If set, the envar PVM_EXPORT is passed. If PVM_EXPORT contains other names (separated by ':') they will be passed too. This is useful for e.g.:
DESCRIPTION.VERBATIM: setenv DISPLAY myworkstation:0.0 setenv MYSTERYVAR 13 setenv PVM_EXPORT DISPLAY:MYSTERYVAR
